name: Pura Puseh Desa Batuan
address: C79G+37, Jl. Raya Batuan, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1:
This place is absolutely stunning and peaceful!!!
We were greeted by warm and friendly staff, who put a sarong on us, and then walked through to the main temple, which was set in the most beautiful gardens.
There was so much to see here, from beautiful story carvings to musical instruments, flowers, and even cats.
The entry fee was so cheap and was more than worth it.
I cannot wait to return to this peaceful place.
review 2: I had a wonderful time visiting Pura Puseh Desa Batuan Bali, a beautiful Hindu temple in the village of Batuan. The temple is very old and has a lot of intricate carvings and statues. I was amazed by the architecture and the atmosphere of the place. I also learned a lot about the history and culture of the Balinese people from the friendly guides. It was a memorable and enriching experience for me.
review 3:
To visit temple, usually it us needed to cover sholders and mandatory to wear a Sarong. I visited during the week and payed 30.000 rp to enter and they lent me a sarong in front of the main entrance.
Ceremony happened at 6pm followed by cultural performances of dance and theater. It was really beautiful to see!
review 4:
Cute little temple.
It is a fast visit unless you get a guide to tell you the story behind it.
It is really not crowded even though it is 5 minutes away from Tegenungan waterfalls
review 5: Pura Puseh Desa Batuan is a stunning 11th-century Hindu temple located in the artistic village of Batuan, Bali. The temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and features exquisite stone carvings, traditional Balinese gates, and thatched-roof shrines. It is a place of worship and cultural preservation for the local community, where visitors can witness the vibrant ceremonies and rituals of Balinese Hinduism. Pura Puseh Desa Batuan is a must-see attraction for anyone interested in the history, architecture, and spirituality of Bali.

name: Dewa Putu Toris Gallery
address: Jl. Raya Batuan No.12, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1:
Has so many beautiful paintings with various styles from various artist!
Visited late around 8/9pm and they were accommodating
The place itself was very big and wide. If you are interested to purchase a painting for your room or house, definitely check this out! The painting are handmade so the prices will be different than the usual mass produced pictures.
They also help with international or national delivery.
review 2: What a wonderful place. 200+++ local artists being supported by the owner of the house, giving them the platform to reach a bigger audience. So many different art styles to look at.
review 3: Very good experience, exquisite art, but they are a bit pushy to sell their painting which makes it a bit unconfortable to admire the art there
review 4: This place might as well be an art museum. Beautiful unique artworks from incredibly talented artists. Staff are friendly and not pushy at all. We got gorgeous paintings we love for a great price.
review 5:
Woah!!! You won't believe the talent here.
You also won't believe the prices
If you want something bargain hard..decide on what you can spend and bring it down to that price.
The Balinese artwork is exquisite. The spaghetti art is crazy awesome.

name: Lawar Jeleka
address: C77F+W62, Batuan, Sukawati, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: If you're a fan of Balinese cuisine, this place is an absolute must-visit! The lawar here is hands down one of the most delicious dishes I've ever tasted. The combination of flavors and textures is simply divine. It's a perfect balance of spiciness, tanginess, and richness that will leave your taste buds dancing with joy. The attention to detail in the presentation is also commendable. The portion sizes are generous, making it worth every penny. From the first bite to the last, you'll be transported to the vibrant streets of Bali. Don't miss out on this culinary gem!
review 2: Really nice nasi lawar! Sooo good, one portion for dine in is 25k includes ice tea and soup. The place actually called Lawar Man Room

name: Ubud Chez Nyoman
address: Jl. Raya Batuan No.18, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1:
Recommendations 500%.
There are not enough star on Google to say that I loved the hostel. There are lots details to explore.
Please, keep it like this, and with same price, it make it accessible.
It s also very close to a beautiful old temple that s worse it, sarong oblige and entrance 30 000, about 2E, sarong included, a woman will borrow it for you.
review 2:
We were living at this villa during 2 weeks.
Everything was chilling and relaxing.
Perfect personal. Thank you.
review 3: My friends and I stayed for 3 weeks and it was a great experience. Nyoman and his family are just wonderful people, they have always helped with any little things for a comfortable stay and I especially want to note incredibly delicious breakfasts. The territory is large and green, there is a swimming pool with sunbeds and daily cleaning. I recommend this place for your stay üòä
review 4: Very affordable price with great facilities. Sleek design, quiet, and also given an interesting book in the roomüëç
review 5: Lovely pace to stay with good price balance. Calm, relaxed and clean.

name: Rumah Lakshmi
address: Jl. Palak, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia

name: Beji Agrotourism
address: C79C+J56, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Really nice little Barista that specialises in Luwuk Mongoose coffee. They showed us around the grounds and ran through the coffee making process, and the roasting of the beans from the Luwuk. They also gave us samples of the different coffees and teas they were selling. The price of the Luwuk coffee is the most expensive but it was worth it if you like bitter coffee. I enjoyed it as well as the sample tea and coffees.
review 2: Stopped here for Luwuk coffee. This place has a variety of coffee and tees. Felt weird at first because this very expensive coffee ($300 Aussie per kg) is process by an animal called Luwuk or mongoose. But the host explained the process and seemed oddly ok. Anyway we all tried it an we even bought some to take back.
review 3: Lovely little hidden coffee plantation. We did a coffee and tea tasting which was lovely. The organic teas and the variation of coffees is amazing. My personal favorite was the vanilla coffee. The Luwak coffee was really good and really strong and the way it is made is just incredible.
review 4: This is a lovely coffee plantation outlet. The guide explained to us the process of coffee making. We were served 9 small cups of sample coffee and 8 of tea, which is very generous. The coffee and tea had various flavours like vanilla, mangosteen, ginger, etc. All the staff were extremely warm and welcoming. The coffee products were also reasonably priced.
review 5: The cutest coffee plantation, the staff were so friendly and the owner is so funny and friendly - such a legend! Coffee is amazing - great experience would highly recommend. Special shout out to our guide komang!

name: Ack Fried Chicken Batuan
address: C79G+55M, Jl. Raya Batuan, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 2: very cheap and good guality, fast and neaty. 1 bowl rice + 1 leg chicken only 11.500 IDR rupiah
review 3: Delicious and fresh fried chicken, very cheap also and big portions
review 4: Friendly service, nice chicken for the price
review 5: Delicious,fresh,clean food set up for costumers

name: Degung Painting Art Gallery
address: Banjar Tengah, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Nice art gallery with very fine and beautiful pieces of local balinese art. You can find three types : traditional, modern and abstract. This is not your "touristy" art that you can find in the center of Ubud or around temples, so the budget requiered reflects that. We bought two nice modern serigraphies depicting two dancers, with which we fell in love. The staff is very nice and professional!
review 2: if you are in Bali visit this gallery to add to your art collection!
review 3: The paintings were absolutely piece of art. Literally.

name: Warung Nyoman Plek Lawar Tewel
address: C78C+VVH, Jl. Raya Batuan, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Find your experience for Balinese authentic food

name: Dewa Ketut Rai Painter
address: C78C+XVX, Jl. Raya Batuan, Batuan, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: One of the painting art shops that has been around for a long time in Batuan, provides various paintings from traditional Batuan to modern ones. The location is strategic on twpi road with ample parking.
review 2: This is a superb gallery. They have many local artists with many different styles of painting. From traditional to modern interpretations of local culture. The gallery is not much to look from the outside but inside it is a no frills place with quality works of art in all budgets. The staff are very helpful with information about the artists and history.
review 3: The whole family compound is a family of artists who can paint just about anything well worth the visit just to see how they put a paining together. Grandad is the salesman and is as funny as. The grandchildren are very skilled
review 4: Good place to find the balinese collection
review 5: 1 million paintings to pick from. Amazing place with amazing prices. You need to see it for yourself.
